content.description: Work up the bolted face on crimps, sidepulls, and slopers. Find the rests in between the strenuous pulls. Follow a trending rail to anchors. Great rock. There is a tricky first section.
content.protection: QDs. A #0.5 towards the top is not needed, but it could be nice. Bolted anchor.
content.location:
This is the obvious bolt line up the face 10 feet right of

Ludicrous Speed

.

content.description:
A few bolts protect the approach up towards the left-facing dihedral. The balancy moves through the bolts is the crux. Once you gain the crack in the corner, it is a straightforward jam on featured rock until the apex of the crack where a large ledge traverse left leads you to a cruxy move to the ledge with shared anchors for

The Bleeps, Sweeps, and the Creeps

. If you go far left of the large ledge and place gear, you can gain a seam just below the roof and traverse in, and over the ledge to the anchors.
content.protection: QDs, a single set from #0.3-#2, (2)#3's, nuts.
content.location:
This is the bolt line 15 feet right of

The Bleeps, Sweeps, and the Creeps

below the obvious dihedral. A single 60 gets you to the broken ledge where you can downclimb.

content.description:
This is the second pitch to either:

The Power of the Schwartz

, or

Dot Matrix

. From the belay, head up the standard, flared crack to where it pinches down. Traverse left as it pinches down. The crux comes at the top. Clip a bolt and make some stem moves to an anchor above. As with others, the more lichen that gets cleaned off this, the better it will be!
content.location:
This is the 2nd pitch above

The Power of the Schwartz

, or

Dot Matrix

up the standard, flared crack. Two rappels with a single 60 will work.

content.description:
This shares the first 20 feet of

Comb the Desert!

. From the dihedral, you go left onto the face for some hard moves that leave you to the arete and some ledgy terrain. Gain the upper section on big but steep holds up the arete. 3/4 of the way up, get a good rest and finish the route on some thin balancy moves to the large ledge and the same anchors as

Comb the Desert

. Good pumpy route! To decrease rope drag, you may want to extend some of the draws lower on the route. A 70m rope gets you to the broken ledge and some down climbing. Two ropes are better!
content.protection: One small piece (0.3 Camalot) and about 12 quickdraws.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Comb the Desert!

content.description:
This is a  continuous crack that eventually ends with the same hand crack as on the

The Bleeps, Sweeps, and the Creeps

. The crack opens and closes enough to make it protect-able. Pulling over the slight roof as it trends right on small jams is excellent!
content.protection: Mostly small gear with a few small hand pieces. A set of nuts.
content.location:
This is the dihedral immediately left of

The Bleeps, Sweeps, and the Creeps

. A 60m rope just gets you to the broken ledge.

content.description: This is a great route that climbs past some steep and interesting features. Pull past the beginning on jugs and trend slightly left with some balance. As you continue, trend right and up some more steep terrain until you gain the difficult mantle and reach before a few moves to the anchor.
content.location:
It is 10 feet left of

Hail Screwed

.

content.description: This is a bit dirty, but it will clean up nice. Clip a bolt to get you started in a crack that keeps on going! Good jamming and stemming lead you high up the cliff to where anchors are visible on the right on a ledge. Do an airy stem to gain, and mantle onto the ledge.
content.protection: Doubles from fingers to #3, singles for small pieces, and a set of nuts.
content.location:
This is the crack system with a single bolt at the beginning which lies 15 feet left of

Ludicrous Speed

.

content.description: Pull some tricky moves off the ground and go past two bolts. From here, make some awkward jams and laybacks with gear.
content.protection: Mostly small gear with a few mid-sized (0.5-0.75) cams and a set of nuts.
content.location:
This is 30 feet right of

Dink Dink

, below the terrace which starts

Dink Dink

. Two obvious bolts lead to the crack system.

content.description:
Climb the bolted start as for

The Power of the Schwartz

. After gaining the corner and making a few chimney moves, find the obvious, positive hand rail and traverse right out across the roof placing a piece and clipping a bolt before gaining the ledge and anchor for

Beam You Down

. This has fun, steep climbing with fun, easy, exposed moves!
content.location:
This is a variation to the

Power of the Schwartz

.

content.description: This is a good warm-up route for the wall. Climb easy terrain to clip the high first bolt. Though the rock is poor in some places, the moves are fun, and with traffic it will clean up. The crux comes mid-route in the steep terrain. A gaston and big moves yield a jug!
content.location:
This is 100 feet left of

Hyperactive Speed

. Stay on the middle terrace and traverse right to a perched spot beneath the route.

content.description: This is a nice long pitch that packs a punch at the end. There is a little bit of everything on this one. Start off with a brief scramble to the dihedral. Sink some fingers in the corner until the dihedral ends. Walk up the ramp and clip a bolt in the broken overhang. Stem, and move past supplementing the bolt with a buried 0.5 Camalot in a slot. Move up some flared cracks towards the obvious two foot roof. Clip a bolt at the roof's lip and make some creative moves past the roof. Some fun face climbing follows till the base of a short, shallow dihedral. Clip bolts to the apex of the dihedral where things get difficult. Make some tenuous moves to gain the ledge and anchors.
content.protection: Small gear, nothing larger than a # 0.5, nuts, slings. I would sling everything until you pass the two foot roof. A 70m is recommended. Bailing off to the right on the ledge is doable with shorter ropes.
content.location:
Go up the obvious face just right of

Dink Dink

and left of the inset dihedral which separates the route from

Hyperactive Speed

. The sharp, distinct corner at the beginning is easy to spot.

climbs.name: The Bleeps, Sweeps, and the Creeps

content.description: This is an awesome route up some great featured stone. Move through the bolts by traversing left and right via the path of least resistance. 20 feet before the ledge with the anchors, traverse left five feet to gain a perfect hand crack that pinches down to a featured finger crack to the ledge.  Superb!
content.protection: 10-12 QDs, a medium-sized nut, a hand-sized, finger-sized, and small piece for the end.
content.location:
Go up the nice face to the left of

The Power of the Schwartz

. A 60m will get you to the blocky ledge.

content.description: This has steep climbing through a roof. The crux comes moving through and over the roof. It requires strong body tension moves.
content.location:
This climbs the steep section 20 feet right of

Power of the Schwartz

. There is a two bolt anchor at the top.
